## IErrorHandlingStrategy.canHandle() method

Determines whether this strategy can handle the given error. This method should perform a quick type check or condition validation to decide if this strategy is appropriate for the error.

**Signature:**

```typescript
canHandle(err: Error): boolean;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

err


</td><td>

Error


</td><td>

The error to evaluate


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

boolean

`true` if this strategy can handle the error, `false` otherwise

## Example


```typescript
// Example implementations:

// Type-based handling
canHandle(err: Error): boolean {
  return err instanceof HttpError;
}

// Condition-based handling
canHandle(err: Error): boolean {
  return err.message.includes("Validation");
}

// Multiple condition handling
canHandle(err: Error): boolean {
  return err instanceof DatabaseError &&
         err.code === 'CONNECTION_TIMEOUT';
}
```
